022package com.restfb;
023
024import static com.restfb.util.StringUtils.isBlank;
025import static com.restfb.util.StringUtils.trimToEmpty;
026import static java.lang.String.format;
027
028import com.restfb.exception.FacebookJsonMappingException;
029
030import java.util.Optional;
031
032/**
033 * Representation of a Facebook API request parameter.
034 * 
035 * @author <a href="http://restfb.com">Mark Allen</a>
036 */
037public final class Parameter {
038  /**
039   * Parameter name.
040   */
041  public final String name;
042
043  /**
044   * Parameter value.
045   */
046  public final String value;
047
048  /**
049   * Creates a new parameter with the given {@code name} and {@code value}.
050   * 
051   * @param name
052   *          The parameter name.
053   * @param value
054   *          The parameter value.
055   * @param jsonMapper
056   *          Mapper for converting the parameter value to JSON.
057   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
058   *           If {@code name} is {@code null} or a blank string or either {@code value} or {@code jsonMapper} is
059   *           {@code null}.
060   */
061  private Parameter(String name, Object value, JsonMapper jsonMapper) {
062    if (isBlank(name) || value == null) {
063      throw new IllegalArgumentException(Parameter.class + " instances must have a non-blank name and non-null value."
064              + " Got instead name:" + name + ", value:" + value);
065    }
066
067    this.value = Optional.ofNullable(jsonMapper).orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalArgumentException("Provided " + JsonMapper.class + " must not be null.")).toJson(value, true);
068    this.name = trimToEmpty(name);
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Factory method which provides an instance with the given {@code name} and {@code value}.
073   * <p>
074   * The {@code value} parameter is often a {@link String} or primitive type like {@link Integer}, but you may pass in a
075   * {@link java.util.List}, {@link java.util.Map}, or your own <tt>@Facebook</tt>-annotated Javabean and it will be
076   * converted to JSON automatically. See the "attachment" section of
077   * <a href="http://wiki.developers.facebook.com/index.php/Stream.publish">the stream.publish API documentation</a> for
078   * an example of where this is useful.
079   * 
080   * @param name
081   *          The parameter name.
082   * @param value
083   *          The parameter value.
084   * @return A {@code Parameter} instance with the given {@code name} and {@code value}.
085   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
086   *           If {@code name} or {@code value} is {@code null} or a blank string.
087   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
088   *           If an error occurs when converting {@code value} to JSON.
089   */
090  public static Parameter with(String name, Object value) {
091    return Parameter.with(name, value, new DefaultJsonMapper());
092  }
093
094  /**
095   * Factory method which provides an instance with the given {@code name} and {@code value}, using the provided
096   * {@code jsonMapper} to turn {@code value} into a JSON string.
097   * <p>
098   * The {@code value} parameter is often a {@link String} or primitive type like {@link Integer}, but you may pass in a
099   * {@link java.util.List}, {@link java.util.Map}, or your own <tt>@Facebook</tt>-annotated Javabean and it will be
100   * converted to JSON automatically. See the "attachment" section of
101   * <a href="http://wiki.developers.facebook.com/index.php/Stream.publish">the stream.publish API documentation</a> for
102   * an example of where this is useful.
103   * 
104   * @param name
105   *          The parameter name.
106   * @param value
107   *          The parameter value.
108   * @param jsonMapper
109   *          The jsonMapper
110   * @return A {@code Parameter} instance with the given {@code name} and {@code value}.
111   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
112   *           If {@code name} or {@code value} is {@code null} or a blank string.
113   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
114   *           If an error occurs when converting {@code value} to JSON.
115   */
116  public static Parameter with(String name, Object value, JsonMapper jsonMapper) {
117    return new Parameter(name, value, jsonMapper);
118  }
119
120  /**
121   * @see java.lang.Object#equals(java.lang.Object)
122   */
123  @Override
124  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
125    if (obj == null) {
126      return false;
127    }
128    if (!getClass().equals(obj.getClass())) {
129      return false;
130    }
131
132    Parameter other = (Parameter) obj;
133
134    if (this.name != other.name && !this.name.equals(other.name)) {
135      return false;
136    }
137
138    return !(this.value != other.value && !this.value.equals(other.value));
139  }
140
141  @Override
142  public int hashCode() {
143    int hash = 7;
144    hash = 37 * hash + this.name.hashCode();
145    hash = 41 * hash + this.value.hashCode();
146    return hash;
147  }
148
149  @Override
150  public String toString() {
151    return format("Parameter[%s=%s]", name, value);
152  }
153}
